div.l: But for the love of God þey hym be soght
Of herborowe and of ese as for her peny
The miller seid aȝene yf ther͗e be ony
For it was nyght and ferther myght þey noght
But for the love of God þey hym be soght
Of herborowe and of ese as for her peny
The miller seid aȝene yf ther͗e be eny
Such as it is yee shul have part
Myn̄ house is streite but yee have lernyd Art
Yee can̄ be Argumentis makyn a plase
A myle brode of xx fote of spase
"~" in left margin may be correction mark.Or make it round with spech as is the gise
Nowe Symond seid Iohn be seynt Cutberd
Ay is ȝowe myry and this is feir͗e answerd
I have herd seid men shal take of twa þingis
Slike as he fynd or slike as he bringis
But specially I pray the my hoost dere
Gete vs som̄ mete and make vs mery chere
And wee wol pay trewly atte ful
With empty hondis men may no hawkis tol
Lo her͗e our͗e sylvir redy for to spend
This Miller to the Town̄ his doghter send
For ale and brede and rostid hem a gose
And bond her hors that they shuld nat go loos
And in his own̄ Chambir hem̄ made a bed
With shetis and shalons feir͗e I spred
Nat from̄ his own̄ bedd ten foot or twelve
His doghtir had a bed al by her selve
Right in the same Chambir by and by
Hit myght be no bet and cause why
There was no rommer herborowe in the plase
They sopyn̄ and spekyn hem̄ to solase
And drynkyn̄ evir strong ale of þe best
About mydnyght went þey to her rest
Wele hath this Miller vernysshid his hede
Ful pale he was for dronk ⁊and nat rede
He rixith and spekith thorowe his nose
